intro: Cnidium suffruticosum, commonly known as Chinese pepper or wild ginger, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Cnidium suffruticosum thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
